column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=3. Optimization Framework

#Text=Before starting the optimization cycle , the fillets of the vane and the blade were removed , as this study was dedicated to understanding the effect of a non-axisymmetrical endwall on secondary flows .
#Text=All steps of the flow diagram are shown in
#Text=Figure 4
#Text=.
#Text=The first task of parameterization in the “ Preparation ” box is elucidated in the following section .
#Text=The parametric geometry , the control points , and the performance parameters defined for the optimization objective were fed to the environment of FINE/Design3D .

#Text=The parametric geometry was screened for performance evaluation with respect to the original geometry and considered appropriate for the optimization cycle because it was a perfect replica of the original geometry .
#Text=The foundation of the optimization framework is the database with the results of all RANS computations performed during the design process .
#Text=Before the optimization cycle begins , it is always necessary to have a sufficient number of samples to initialize the optimization process .
#Text=In this study , the initial database was comprised of a combination of the samples generated through the Latin Hypercube Sampling ( LHS ) method and random sampling method .
#Text=The number of initial samples was more than 10 times the number of control points of the stator hub and the rotor hub , and these were fed into the approximation model .
#Text=Steady RANS were solved for each of the samples and converged solutions were stored in the database .

#Text=To reduce the computational cost , the connection between the optimization target ( objective function ) and the initial database samples was established through some approximation model that replaced numerical simulations before the optimization cycle .
#Text=BPNN was used as an approximation model because of the excellent capability of non-linear mappings which led to the best reproduction of initial samples contained in the database .
#Text=BPNN consists of two hidden layers in between the first layer containing the information of perturbed endwall geometry and the last layer containing the information of performance parameters .
#Text=Using small random values , the weight and bias factors are initialized , and the information is passed to the next layer through a sigmoidal transfer function .
#Text=Usually , the output vector provided by the network corresponds to the desired output vector in the forward training phase of BPNN iteration .
#Text=The error between the real and desired value is back-propagated to the network input to adjust connecting weights and minimize the error .
#Text=This process of updating weights is repeated for each training set until the weights converged in the backward process .
#Text=This is why it is called a back-propagating neural network .
#Text=BPNN in conjunction with the genetic algorithm was successfully used by Demeulenaere et al. for the formulation of single objective functions .
#Text=Therefore , BPNN predicted the approximate relationship between the design control variables and performance .
#Text=The optimum solutions were found based on this relationship by using the optimization technique formed in NSGA-II , which was developed by Deb et al. .
#Text=The result of every design iteration was determined by solving three-dimensional steady RANS .
#Text=The result of each iteration was inspected and anticipated to be in accordance with the criterion of the minimization of the objective function .
#Text=NSGA-II is a multi-objective evolutionary algorithm and searches for a set of optimum solutions called a “ Pareto set ” .
#Text=An individual dominates another individual if and only if the objectives of the former are better than the objective of the latter .
#Text=The solutions that were not dominated by other solutions form the “ Pareto front set ” , and the best solution was selected from among these .
